intro: Palisota ebo, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped, with a rough texture and serrated edges. Palisota ebo produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences.
